column4: hey could someone please give me some help with patching my kernel so I can get my USB controller working?
hi
hey calamari, do you know anything about patching kernels?
lol sorry, Im desperate
no, sorry..
I'd assume there is a faq, mini-faq, or howto for it somewhere out there for it
do you have the patch downloaded?
that is the binary file that the compiler produced
okay.. like I say, I know nothing about patching kernels.. but in other pojects I've seen, patches are applied to source code, not binaries
this would make sense too, because the source is always the same.. binaries are not
I asumme you've also untarred/unzipped the patch?
interesting.. I'm not familiar with that for patches
yeah I found it weird too
how big is it?
its actually one of the bugs on ubuntu's bugzilla
its not that big
can you dcc it to me?
relativly small, so definatly not the whole kernel
hold Ill get you the URL where i got it from
even better :)
This is the related bug: https://bugzilla.ubuntu.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1971 and Ill just get the patch URL
this is the file I downloaded http://gondor.apana.org.au/~herbert/ubuntu/acpi/vmlinuz-2.6.8.1-3-686.2
I was reading the bugzilla page you gave me.. I believe I can help
you can?
